alert.note: Alert for Burnett; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 9:39PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN WASHBURN AND SOUTHEASTERN BURNETT COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 PM CDT... At 938 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms near Hertel, or 10 miles west of Spooner, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spooner and Trego. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
